hints.content: To divide a shape in thirds, we divide the whole into **$3$ equal parts**.

This circle is divided into $3$ pieces, but the pieces are not equal in size:  

![A circle is divided into 3 parts. One part is half the circle. The other part is divided into two sections.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/149eeab750323e1daddf13a8624c27e774d0ac00)

This circle is divided into $2$ equal pieces:  

![A circle is divided into two equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/46d14851c942db6ccae854e1c9c87615ab2c9348)

These circles are divided into thirds:  

![Two circles are each divided into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/54dd96691f7fb8a34a00523304a19b0f8b0157c0) ![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fdcbe2191a640aaf5e424e622228cf6134a2ab2c)

question.content:
**Which circles are divided into thirds?**

choices.content: ![A circle is divided into two equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/46d14851c942db6ccae854e1c9c87615ab2c9348)

![A circle is divided into 3 parts. One part is half the circle. The other part is divided into two sections. ](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/149eeab750323e1daddf13a8624c27e774d0ac00)
